RULE.DESCRIPTION: This policy takes as input the IoT devices from the Enterprise Discovery policy.
RULE.NAME: 1.1.02 IoT Discover

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Normally additional processing is not done on detected NAT devices, as they are usually against the AUP., hence the add to group action is disabled.
This sub-rule quickly identifies any NAT devices on the network so that IT staff can remove them from the network.
INNER_RULE.NAME: NAT Devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: ProServ 7.0
INNER_RULE.NAME: Windows

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Looks for host in the Passive_Learning segment and automatically adds them to the Passive Learning group - this disables all active scans for those hosts. Admission resolve delay is 1 second in order to catch devices as soon as they are admitted to the network.
RULE.NAME: 1.1.00 Discover Method

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Macintosh" group that is maintained by the 1.1 Enterprise Manageability > Macintosh sub-policy. All detected Macintosh devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
If Macintosh devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Macintosh Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.03 macOS Manageability

INNER_RULE.NAME: {Untrusted} Port 22 Available but NOT Managed via SSH

RULE.DESCRIPTION: A basic Mobile Device Classify policy for general use. If there is an MDM orchestration, this policy will need to be modified.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.07 Mobile Devices

RULE.DESCRIPTION: While most NAT devices will require immediate investigation and remediation, it is possible that some are allowed. This policy will separate the Exempt NAT Devices from all NAT devices detected, and notify the Default CounterACT admin via email action of unauthorized NAT devices on the network.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.01 NAT Devices Classification

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: NAT devices which have been manually added to the "Exempt NAT Devices" group are detected by this subrule and separated from unauthorized NAT devices.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Semi Trusted} Approved NAT devices

PARAM.NAME: subject
PARAM.VALUE: CounterACT: Rogue NAT Device detected at {ip}

PARAM.NAME: message

CONDITION.LABEL: SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:3, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):*EMPTY*, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:1, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):public-v1, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:2, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):public-v2, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:2, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):admin-v2, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Full-trust device verification can be done using DEX to query the Cisco Call Manager server, or by using cURL conditions to scrape the web status page from each phone (if enabled).
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Semi Trusted} Cisco IP Phones

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Full-trust verification can be done by enabling SNMP on Avaya phones with a unique community string or v3 credential.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Semi Trusted} Avaya IP Phones

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Windows" group that is built by the 1.1 Enterprise Discovery > Windows sub-policy. All detected Windows devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
When Windows devices are not manageable by CounterACT the remaining sub-policies use various available attributes to separate possible corporate machines needing maintenance from suspected guests and known unauthorized windows devices.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
If SecureConnector is to be used on Domain managed Windows machines which are also manageable by CounterACT using Remote Inspection, it is recommended to add a sub-rule above the first, with both of those criteria.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.02 Windows Enterprise Manageability

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Machines managed via the Host Property Scanner Domain Credentials are added the "Managed Windows Devices" group.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Fully Trusted} Domain Managed (Current)
{Fully Trusted} Secure Connector Managed NOT Domain Managed

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies machines that have changed state and are not currently manageable
This can identify possible issues with the Windows infrastructure and should be investigated for root cause.
This is also a safety mechanism to keep corporate hosts from becoming restricted if such a condition is detected.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Fully Trusted} Previously Domain Managed

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This sub-policy identifies machines that are members of a Domain defined in the HPS plugin but are not manageable.
Typically these machines need maintenance to become managed, or should be manually exempted after approval.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Fully Trusted} Domain Member but NOT Manageable

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This rule identifies unmanaged machines that have been manually approved and exempted by a CounterACT administrator via the "Exempt Groups > Exempt Windows Devices" group.
This should be used when a known quantity Windows machine must remain on the network but cannot be managed (technical or political justification) and has been given special permission to operate outside of the normal AUP..
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Semi Trusted} Manually Exempted Windows Devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
Machines that are using the correct NetBIOS domain/workgroup name, but are not manageable via domain credentials and have not been verified as actual Domain members will be identified by this policy.
These can include: - Machines with broken Domain accounts (need to be re-joined - Machines impersonating the domain name, but are in a Workgroup. - Misconfigured lab or test machines
These should be investigated and legitimate machines remediated.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Untrusted} <CHANGE-ME> Corp NetBIOS Domain

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION:
The remaining Windows devices that have not provided enough properties for host Clarification or events detected on the SPAN interface.
This is typically the one of the first places to begin enforcement/remediation actions.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Untrusted} Unknown Windows Machines

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Linux/Unix" group that is maintained by the 1.1 Enterprise Manageability > Linux sub-policy. All detected Linux/Unix devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
If Linux\Unix devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "Managed Nix Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.04 Linux Manageability

INNER_RULE.NAME: {Untrusted} Port 22 Available but NOT Managed via SSH

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Network Devices" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Network sub-policy. All detected Network devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
The sub-policies check for manageability using the SNMP strings that are also used by the Switch Plugin.
Intended usage is to baseline network devices and managed vs unmanaged switches outside of the switch plugin for comparison and tuning.
RULE.NAME: 1.2.05 Network Device Manageability <Edit SNMP>

INNER_RULE.NAME: {Fully Trusted} Managed Wireless APs & Controllers (Wireless Plugin)
{Fully Trusted} Managed Switch Device (SW Plugin & SNMP) <Edit SNMP string>

CONDITION.LABEL: SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:2, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):*EMPTY*, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

INNER_RULE.NAME: {Fully Trusted} Managed Switch Device (SW Plugin Only)
{Fully Trusted} Corporate Network Device (SNMP) <Edit SNMP string>

CONDITION.LABEL: SNMP-MIB-II sysDescription Privacy Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none, Authentication Protocol Password (V3 only):*******, SNMP Version:2, Community (V1 or V2 only):*******, Additional SNMP Parameters:*EMPTY*, Username (V3 only):*EMPTY*, Privacy Authentication Protocol (V3 only):none

PATH.VALUE: Operational Technology/Non-Industry Specific/Facilities/Building Automation/Uninterruptible Power Supply
Operational Technology/Metal & Allied/Metal & Allied - Industrial Control Systems
Operational Technology/Metal & Allied/Metal & Allied - Industrial Control Systems

Operational Technology/Energy & Power/Energy & Power - Industrial Control Systems

PARAM.VALUE: id:7683623816074220333;name:Energy and Power - Industrial Control Systems

PATH.VALUE: Operational Technology/Non-Industry Specific/Facilities/Physical Security/License Plate Recognition
Operational Technology/Non-Industry Specific/Facilities/Physical Security/License Plate Recognition

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Added the somewhat redundant condition "Member of Group = Gaming" to stop the warning every time you Apply policy changes. This policy is basically just a place holder policy for when there are SUB groups to "Gaming" - currently there are none.
INNER_RULE.NAME: {Semi Trusted} Gaming devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Peer-to-peer applications are running.
INNER_RULE.NAME: P2P Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Peer-to-peer applications are installed.
INNER_RULE.NAME: P2P Installed

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit AV vendor in sub-rules 1 and 2. Also enable add to group action in sub-rule 2 if customer considers "AV not up to date" to be non compliant.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.01 Antivirus Assessment <edit action& vendor>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV Running - 2 Weeks Update Date
INNER_RULE.NAME: Antivirus Running & Up to Date <edit vendor>

CONDITION.LABEL: Windows Antivirus Update Date :Value : All items

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV Running but 2 or more weeks out of date. An action does exist to initiate a Antivirus Update. Use at customer discretion.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Antivirus Running & Not Up To Date <edit action & vendor>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV Installed - Not Running
INNER_RULE.NAME: Antivirus Installed & Not Running <edit vendor>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Any Supported AV is not installed
INNER_RULE.NAME: Antivirus Not Installed

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Minimal devices should be present
INNER_RULE.NAME: Irresolvable

RULE.DESCRIPTION: The list "Blacklisted Applications" which is tied to the property "Windows Processes Running" is used in this policy. Additional applications which should not be run in the environment should be added to this list.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.06 Blacklisted Applications Assessment <edit List values>

HOST_PROPERTY_LIST.DESCRIPTION: This is a list of blacklisted applications
HOST_PROPERTY_LIST.NAME: Blacklisted Applications

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit the Cloud Storage Compliant if any are allowed.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.03 Rogue Cloud Storage Applications Assessment <edit if any are allowed>

INNER_RULE.NAME: Cloud Storage Compliant <edit if any allowed>
Disk Encryption Installed and Fully Encrypted
Disk Encryption Installed and Not Encrypted

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit first subrule if any IM is allowed.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.1.05 Instant Messaging Applications Assessment <edit if any allowed>

INNER_RULE.NAME: Windows IM Compliant <edit if any allowed>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Instant Messaging applications are running.
INNER_RULE.NAME: IM Running

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Instant Messaging applications installed.
INNER_RULE.NAME: IM Installed

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit the subrules to configure the Add to Group "Antivirus Non Compliant" for every subrule where this is the case for the deployment.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.2.01 macOS Antivirus Assessment <add to group>

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:sudo grep Version /etc/cma.d/EPOAGENT3700MACX/config.xml
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:sudo grep Version /etc/cma.d/EPOAGENT3700MACX/config.xml

INNER_RULE.NAME: Macintosh McAfee ePO Config File NOT Present
Macintosh McAfee ePO NOT Detected - Investigate
Macintosh Casper Installed but Not Running

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh File Exists File Name (full path):/Library/Application Support/JAMF/JAMF.Keychain
Macintosh File Exists File Name (full path):/Library/Application Support/JAMF/JAMF.Keychain

INNER_RULE.NAME: macOS is NOT Up to Date

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Checks the status of the macOS host-based firewall.
RULE.NAME: 1.3.2.06 macOS Firewall Assessment

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:/usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --getglobalstate
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:/usr/libexec/ApplicationFirewall/socketfilterfw --getglobalstate

INNER_RULE.NAME: Macintosh McAfee Antivirus Running and Updated
Macintosh McAfee Antivirus Running but Not Updated
Macintosh McAfee Antivirus Installed but Not Running
Macintosh McAfee Antivirus NOT Detected - Investigate

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:fdesetup status
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:diskutil apfs list
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:diskutil cs list
Macintosh Expected Script Result Command or Script File:fdesetup -status

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Devices that have have been previously identified as "Non Corporate Devices" are restricted from network access by this policy.
RULE.NAME: 2.01 Non Corporate Device Control <edit VLAN & WLAN actions, List values>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: The two configured actions are vendor specific. Select the appropriate action.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unathorized Wireless Devices <edit action>
Unauthorized Wired Other Switches - VLAN <edit VLAN>

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Devices that have have been previously identified as "Non Compliant Devices" have limited network access for remediation. Virtual Firewall is a fallback restrict action for any subrule, depending on vendor interoperability.
RULE.NAME: 2.02 Non Compliant Device Control <edit: exceptions, VLANs, List values>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Action is vendor specific. Select the appropriate action.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wireless Devices (block or role change by vendor)

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Blocking all access other than remediation servers using ACL exceptions to grant access. ACL exceptions must be editied for specific environments.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wired Cisco/Brocade - ACL <edit Exceptions>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Select a VLAN, by number or name, which will provide access to Remediation servers only.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Non Compliant Wired Other Switches - VLAN <edit VLAN>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Edit vFW exceptions to allow access to the remediation servers.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Unknown Device Location <edit Exceptions>

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Device is a virtual machine and connected to a managed virtual host. *Note, this will only work if connectivity to vSphere/ESXi is setup**
INNER_RULE.NAME: VMWare

RULE.DESCRIPTION: This policy is used to identify users details. This is where you would add departments and other user specific policies
RULE.NAME: 3.2.0.4 User Details

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Operating system
RULE.NAME: 3.2.03 Operating System
4.x User Password Expire Notification <edit PW age>

PARAM.NAME: message

RULE.DESCRIPTION: If there are corporate manageable Mobile devices on the network, a separate 1.2.3.2 Mobile Device Manageability policy should be created and properly rolled out using criteria from the corporate MDM.
RULE.NAME: 4.X Mobile Devices by OS

HOST_PROPERTY_LIST.NAME: VMware ESXi Server Product Line IDs

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Full-Trust devices are classified using the one of the following methods, SSH, SNMP, WMI, URL login, query external management system. This provideds confidence that a device is corporately owned as the policies are authenticating using a piece of the customers configuration that has been deployed by the device owner.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Fully Trusted devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: Semi-Trust devices will be classified by one of the following methods, using device properties and profiles of known device types. When using these methods customers can be sure that the device is corporately owned, however there is an increased risk that the device could be rouge as the policy is relying on properties that can be spoofed e.g. Mac address, DHCP hostname and NetBios
INNER_RULE.NAME: Semi Trusted devices

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: UnTrusted devices are devices that do not match any full-trust or semi-trust policy rules. These devices are typically rouges and will have an enforcement action applied to limit their network access.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Untrusted devices

RULE.DESCRIPTION: If there are corporate manageable Mobile devices on the network, a separate 1.2.3.2 Mobile Device Manageability policy should be created and properly rolled out using criteria from the corporate MDM.
RULE.NAME: 4.1.08 Mobile Devices by OS
